title: How to View a PDF Document in Full Screen View

steps.title: Click Full Screen View on the View menu.
steps.content: Click Full Screen View on the View menu. Alternatively, press CTRL + L. Acrobat displays the document in full screen view. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Press the DOWN ARROW key, the RIGHT ARROW key or the ENTER key to view the next page of the document.
steps.content: Press the DOWN ARROW key, the RIGHT ARROW key or the ENTER key to view the next page of the document.

steps.title: Press the UP ARROW key, the LEFT ARROW key, or SHIFT + ENTER to view the previous page of the document.
steps.content: Press the UP ARROW key, the LEFT ARROW key, or SHIFT + ENTER to view the previous page of the document. [3] X Research source

steps.title: To return to the normal view of the document, press CTRL + L.
steps.content: To return to the normal view of the document, press CTRL + L. Note: You can also set the full screen view preferences, to enable you to use the Esc (Escape) key to return to the normal view of the document.

steps.title: Click Preferences on the Edit menu.
steps.content: Click Preferences on the Edit menu. The Preferences dialog box is displayed. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Select Full Screen from the list on the left side of the Preferences dialog box.
steps.content: Select Full Screen from the list on the left side of the Preferences dialog box. The Preferences dialog box displays the full screen options. [5] X Research source

steps.title: To automatically advance the document pages, select the Advance every check box and type the time in seconds that each page should be displayed in the seconds text box.
steps.content: To automatically advance the document pages, select the Advance every check box and type the time in seconds that each page should be displayed in the seconds text box. Note: You can browse through a document using mouse or keyboard commands even if the Advance every check box is selected.

steps.title: To return to the first page after the last page is displayed, select the Loop after last page check box.
steps.content: To return to the first page after the last page is displayed, select the Loop after last page check box.

steps.title: Select the Escape key exits check box to enable you to exit the full screen view by pressing the Esc (Escape) key.
steps.content: Select the Escape key exits check box to enable you to exit the full screen view by pressing the Esc (Escape) key.

steps.title: Select the Left click to go forward one page; right click to go back one page check box to enable you to page through a document by clicking the mouse.
steps.content: Select the Left click to go forward one page; right click to go back one page check box to enable you to page through a document by clicking the mouse. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Select the Ignore all transitions check box to remove transition effects from presentations that you view in Full Screen view.
steps.content: Select the Ignore all transitions check box to remove transition effects from presentations that you view in Full Screen view.

steps.title: To specify a default transition effect to display when you page through a document, select a transition effect from the Default transition drop-down list.
steps.content: To specify a default transition effect to display when you page through a document, select a transition effect from the Default transition drop-down list. [7] X Research source

steps.title: To specify the behavior of the mouse in full screen view, select an option from the Mouse cursor drop-down list.
steps.content: To specify the behavior of the mouse in full screen view, select an option from the Mouse cursor drop-down list.

steps.title: Select a background color for the screen from the Background color fly-out menu.
steps.content: Select a background color for the screen from the Background color fly-out menu. The background color is used to color the empty area of the screen, when a page of a document is not large enough to cover the entire screen.

steps.title: Click OK to close the Preferences dialog box.
steps.content: Click OK to close the Preferences dialog box. The preferences you have specified will apply to all PDF documents that you view in full screen view. [8] X Research source
